soc.robot

Class SOCRobotClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.baseclient.SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient
      • soc.robot.SOCRobotClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SOCMessageDispatcher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sample3PClient

    public class SOCRobotClient
extends SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient
    This is a robot client that can play Settlers of Catan.

    When ready, call init() to start the bot's threads and connect to the server. (Built-in bots should set printedInitialWelcome beforehand to reduce console clutter.) Once connected, messages from the server are processed in dispatch(SOCMessage, Connection). For each game this robot client plays, there is a SOCRobotBrain.

    The built-in robots must be the same version as the server, to simplify things. Third-party bots might be based on this code and be other versions, to simplify their code.

    The IMAROBOT connect message gives the bot's class name and a required security cookie, which is passed into the robot client constructor and which must match the server's generated cookie. You can set the server's cookie by setting the server's jsettlers.bots.cookie parameter, or view it by setting jsettlers.bots.showcookie, when starting the server.

    Once a bot has connected to the server, it waits to be asked to join games via BOTJOINREQUEST messages. When it receives that message type, the bot replies with JOINGAME and the server responds with JOINGAMEAUTH. That message handler creates a SOCRobotBrain to play the game it is joining.

    Debugging

    Several bot debug messages are available by sending text messages from other players with certain keywords. See handleGAMETEXTMSG_debug(SOCGameTextMsg) for details.

    Third-Party Bots

    Third-party robot clients can be built from scratch, or extend this class and/or SOCRobotBrain. If extending this class, please remember to:
    • Update rbclass value before calling init()
    • Override createBrain(SOCRobotParameters, SOCGame, CappedQueue) to provide your subclass of SOCRobotBrain
    • Override buildClientFeats() if your bot's optional client features differ from the standard bot
    See Sample3PClient for a trivial example subclass.

    I18N

    The bot ignores the contents of all SOCGameServerText messages and has no locale. If robot debug commands (SOCGameTextMsg) are sent to the bot, its responses to the server are in English.
    Author:
    Robert S Thomas

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_TEST_QUIT_AT_JOINREQ

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_TEST_QUIT_AT_JOINREQ
        For server testing, system property "jsettlers.bots.test.quit_at_joinreq" to randomly disconnect from the server when asked to join a game. If set, value is the disconnect percentage 0-100.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • debugRandomPause

        protected static boolean debugRandomPause
        For debugging/regression testing, randomly pause responding for several seconds, to simulate a "stuck" robot brain.

        Note: This debugging tool is not scalable to many simultaneous games, because it delays all messages, not just ones for a specific game / brain, and it won't be our turn in each of those games.

        Because of the limited scope, currently there is no way to enable this debug flag at runtime; the value must be edited here in the source.

        Since:
        1.1.11
        See Also:
        DEBUGRANDOMPAUSE_FREQ, debugRandomPauseActive

      • debugRandomPauseActive

        protected boolean debugRandomPauseActive
        Is debugRandomPause currently in effect for this client? If so, this flag becomes true while pausing. When true, store messages into debugRandomPauseQueue instead of sending them to robotBrains immediately. The pause goes on until debugRandomPauseUntil arrives and then debugRandomPauseActive becomes false until the next random float below DEBUGRANDOMPAUSE_FREQ. This is all handled within dispatch(SOCMessage, Connection).
        Since:
        1.1.11

      • debugRandomPauseQueue

        protected java.util.Vector<SOCMessage> debugRandomPauseQueue
        When debugRandomPauseActive is true, store incoming messages from the server into this queue until debugRandomPauseUntil. Initialized in dispatch(SOCMessage, Connection).
        Since:
        1.1.11

      • debugRandomPauseUntil

        protected long debugRandomPauseUntil
        When debugRandomPauseActive is true, resume at this time; same format as System.currentTimeMillis().
        Since:
        1.1.11
        See Also:
        DEBUGRANDOMPAUSE_SECONDS

      • DEBUGRANDOMPAUSE_FREQ

        protected static final double DEBUGRANDOMPAUSE_FREQ
        When debugRandomPause is true but not debugRandomPauseActive, frequency of activating it; checked for each non-SOCGameTextMsg and non-SOCGameServerText message received during our own turn. Default is 0.04 (4%).
        Since:
        1.1.11
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEBUGRANDOMPAUSE_SECONDS

        protected static final int DEBUGRANDOMPAUSE_SECONDS
        When debugRandomPauseActive is activated, pause this many seconds before continuing. Default is 12.
        See Also:
        debugRandomPauseUntil, Constant Field Values

        protected java.lang.String rbclass

        Since:
        2.0.00

      • brainQs

        protected java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,CappedQueue<SOCMessage>> brainQs
        the message queues for the different brains

      • gameOptions

        protected java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,SOCGameOptionSet> gameOptions
        Options for all games on the server we've been asked to join. Some games may have no options, so will have no entry here, although they will have an entry in SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient.games once joined. Key = game name.

        Entries are added in handleBOTJOINGAMEREQUEST(SOCBotJoinGameRequest). Since the robot and server are the same version, the set of "known options" will always be in sync.

      • gamesPlayed

        protected int gamesPlayed
        number of games this bot has played

        number of games finished

        protected int gamesWon
        number of games this bot has won

        start time

      • printedInitialWelcome

        public boolean printedInitialWelcome
        Have we printed the initial welcome message text from server? Suppress further ones (disconnect-reconnect).

        Can also set this true before calling init() to avoid printing the initial welcome.

        Since:
        1.1.06

      • SOCRobotClient

        public SOCRobotClient(ServerConnectInfo sci,
                      java.lang.String nn,
                      java.lang.String pw)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor for a robot which will connect to a TCP or local server. Does not actually connect here: Call init() when ready.
        Parameters:
        sci - Server connect info (TCP or local) with robotCookie; not null
        nn - nickname for robot
        pw - Optional password for robot, or null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sci == null
        Since:
        2.2.00

      • SOCRobotClient

        public SOCRobotClient(java.lang.String h,
                      int p,
                      java.lang.String nn,
                      java.lang.String pw,
                      java.lang.String co)
        Deprecated. In v2.2.00 and newer, use the SOCRobotClient(ServerConnectInfo, String, String) constructor instead:
        new SOCRobotClient(new ServerConnectInfo(h, p, co), nn, pw);
        Constructor for a robot which will connect to the specified host, on the specified port. Does not actually connect here: Call init() when ready.

        This deprecated constructor is kept only for compatibility with third-party bot clients.

        Parameters:
        h - host
        p - port
        nn - nickname for robot
        pw - password for robot
        co - cookie for robot connections to server

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initialize the robot player; connect to server and send first messages including our version, features from buildClientFeats(), and rbclass. If fails to connect, sets SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient.ex and prints it to System.err.

      • disconnectReconnect

        public void disconnectReconnect()
        Disconnect and then try to reconnect. Sends the same messages as init(). If the reconnect fails, will retry a maximum of 3 times. If those attempts all fail, SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient.connected will be false and SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient.ex will be set. Otherwise when method returns, SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient.connected is true and ex is null.

      • buildClientFeats

        protected SOCFeatureSet buildClientFeats()
        Build the set of optional client features this bot supports, to send to the server. (SOCFeatureSet.CLIENT_6_PLAYERS, etc.)

        Third-party subclasses should override this if their features are different.

        The built-in robots' client features are currently:

        • SOCFeatureSet.CLIENT_6_PLAYERS
        • SOCFeatureSet.CLIENT_SEA_BOARD
        • SOCFeatureSet.CLIENT_SCENARIO_VERSION = Version.versionNumber()
        For robot debugging and testing, will also add a feature from SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient.PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_CLIENT_GAMEOPT3P if set, and create that Known Option with SOCGameOption.FLAG_3RD_PARTY if not already created: Calls SOCGameOptionSet.addKnownOption(SOCGameOption).

        Called from init().

        Returns:
        This bot's set of implemented optional client features, if any, or an empty set (not null)
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • createBrain

        public SOCRobotBrain createBrain(SOCRobotParameters params,
                                 SOCGame ga,
                                 CappedQueue<SOCMessage> mq)
        Factory method for creating a new SOCRobotBrain.

        Third-party clients can override this method to use this client with different robot brain subclasses.

        Parameters:
        params - the robot parameters to use
        ga - the game in which the brain will play
        mq - the inbound message queue for this brain from the client
        Returns:
        the newly created brain
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • dispatchFirst

        public void dispatchFirst(SOCMessage message,
                          Connection connection)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • dispatch

        public void dispatch(SOCMessage mes,
                     Connection connection)
        dispatch the incoming messages to the appropriate message handler Messages of unknown type are ignored. All SOCGameServerText messages are ignored (mes will be null from SOCMessage.toMsg(String)).

        Note: If a message doesn't need any robot-specific handling, and doesn't appear as a specific case in this method's switch, this method calls SOCMessageDispatcher.dispatch(SOCMessage, Connection) for it.

        Parameters:
        mes - A generic SOCMessage to be handled. This method must figure out what kind of message it is to dispatch it correctly
        connection - Connection (peer) sending this message. Will never be null.

      • handleVERSION

        protected void handleVERSION(boolean isLocal,
                             SOCVersion mes)
        Handle the "version" message, server's version report.

        Because SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient is used only for the robot, and the robot should always be the same version as the server, don't ask server for info about game option deltas between the two versions.

        If somehow the server isn't our version, print an error and disconnect.

        Overrides:
        handleVERSION in class SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient
        Parameters:
        isLocal - Is the server local, or remote? Client can be connected only to local, or remote.
        mes - the message
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • handleBOTJOINGAMEREQUEST

        protected void handleBOTJOINGAMEREQUEST(SOCBotJoinGameRequest mes)
        handle the "join game request" message. Remember the game options, and record in seatRequests. Send a JOINGAME to server in response. Server will reply with JOINGAMEAUTH.

        Board resets are handled similarly.

        In v1.x this method was handleJOINGAMEREQUEST.

        Parameters:
        mes - the message
        See Also:
        handleRESETBOARDAUTH(SOCResetBoardAuth)

      • handleSTATUSMESSAGE

        protected void handleSTATUSMESSAGE(SOCStatusMessage mes)
        handle the "status message" message by printing it to System.err; messages with status value 0 are ignored (no problem is being reported) once the initial welcome message has been printed. Status SOCStatusMessage.SV_SERVER_SHUTDOWN calls Connection.disconnect() so as to not print futile reconnect attempts on the terminal.
        Overrides:
        handleSTATUSMESSAGE in class SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient
        Parameters:
        mes - the message
        Since:
        1.1.00

        Overrides:

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • handleGAMEMEMBERS

        protected void handleGAMEMEMBERS(SOCGameMembers mes)
        handle the "game members" message, which indicates the entire game state has now been sent. If we have a seatRequests for this game, request to sit down now: send SOCSitDown.
        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • handleRESETBOARDAUTH

        protected void handleRESETBOARDAUTH(SOCResetBoardAuth mes)
        handle board reset (new game with same players, same game name). Destroy old Game object. Unlike SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient.handleRESETBOARDAUTH, don't call SOCGame.resetAsCopy().

        Take robotbrain out of old game, don't yet put it in new game. Let server know we've done so, by sending LEAVEGAME via leaveGame(SOCGame, String, boolean, boolean). Server will soon send a BOTJOINGAMEREQUEST if we should join the new game.

        Overrides:
        handleRESETBOARDAUTH in class SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient
        Parameters:
        mes - the message
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        SOCServer.resetBoardAndNotify(String, int), handleBOTJOINGAMEREQUEST(SOCBotJoinGameRequest)

      • sendRecordsText

        protected void sendRecordsText(java.lang.String gaName,
                               java.lang.String key,
                               boolean oldNotCurrent)
        Call sendText on each string element of a record from SOCRobotBrain.getDRecorder() or SOCRobotBrain.getOldDRecorder(). If no records found or ! DebugRecorder.isOn(), sends text to let the user know.
        Parameters:
        gaName - Game name; if no brain found for game, does nothing
        key - Recorder key for strings to send; not null
        oldNotCurrent - True if should use SOCRobotBrain.getOldDRecorder() instead of getDRecorder()
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • debugPrintBrainStatus

        public void debugPrintBrainStatus(java.lang.String gameName,
                                  boolean sendTextToGame)
        Print brain variables and status for this game, to System.err or as SOCGameTextMsg sent to the game's members, by calling SOCRobotBrain.debugPrintBrainStatus().
        Parameters:
        gameName - Game name; if no brain for that game, do nothing.
        sendTextToGame - Send to game as SOCGameTextMsg if true, otherwise print to System.err.
        Since:
        1.1.13

      • leaveGame

        public void leaveGame(SOCGame ga,
                      java.lang.String leaveReason,
                      boolean showReason,
                      boolean showDebugTrace)
        the user leaves the given game
        Parameters:
        ga - the game
        leaveReason - reason for leaving
        showReason - If true print bot, game, and leaveReason even if not D.ebugIsEnabled()
        showDebugTrace - If true print current thread's stack trace

      • addCleanKill

        public void addCleanKill()
        add one to the number of clean brain kills

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Connection to server has raised an error; leave all games, then try to reconnect.
        Overrides:
        destroy in class SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        for stand-alones
